description: [Status: stable] [Name: complex-structure] [Message: {name} is too complex ({complexity} > {max_complexity})] What it does Checks for functions with a high McCabe complexity. Why is this bad? The McCabe complexity of a function is a measure of the complexity of the control flow graph of the function. It is calculated by adding one to the number of decision points in the function. A decision point is a place in the code where the program has a choice of two or more paths to follow. Functions with a high complexity are hard to understand and maintain. Example def foo(a, b, c): if a: if b: if c: return 1 else: return 2 else: return 3 else: return 4 Use instead: def foo(a, b, c): if not a: return 4 if not b: return 3 if not c: return 2 return 1

lint.mccabe.max-complexity.option_description:
The maximum McCabe complexity to allow before triggering C901 errors.



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.mccabe]
# Flag errors (`C901`) whenever the complexity level exceeds 5.
max-complexity = 5



[lint.mccabe]
# Flag errors (`C901`) whenever the complexity level exceeds 5.
max-complexity = 5
